arr.name: dc.description
arr.str: This instrument contains two sets of pictures used in De Jong and Vercellotti (2015): 1) Heaton, J. B. (1966). Composition Through Pictures. Essex: Longman. (stories: Bicycle, Race, Tiger). These drawings were produced by James Moss (illustrator) and originally appeared in Heaton, J. B. (1966). Composition Through Pictures. Essex: Longman. All attempts have been made to contact the author and illustrator to request permission for the drawings to be uploaded to IRIS. All sources must be cited when using or developing the drawings in research. The drawings may not be used for commercial purposes. For more information, please see https://www.iris-database.org/iris/app/home/about#ethical. 2) Mayer, M. (1967). A Boy, a Dog, and a Frog. New York: Dial Books for Young Readers. (6 drawings used). These drawings were produced by Mercer Mayer and originally appeared in Mayer, M. (1967). A Boy, a Dog, and a Frog. New York: Dial Books for Young Readers. All attempts have been made to request permission for the drawings to be held in IRIS. All sources must be cited when using or developing the drawings in research. The drawings may not be used for commercial purposes. For more information, please see https://www.iris-database.org/iris/app/home/about#ethical

This instrument contains two sets of pictures used in De Jong and Vercellotti (2015): 1) Heaton, J. B. (1966). Composition Through Pictures. Essex: Longman. (stories: Bicycle, Race, Tiger). These drawings were produced by James Moss (illustrator) and originally appeared in Heaton, J. B. (1966). Composition Through Pictures. Essex: Longman. All attempts have been made to contact the author and illustrator to request permission for the drawings to be uploaded to IRIS. All sources must be cited when using or developing the drawings in research. The drawings may not be used for commercial purposes. For more information, please see https://www.iris-database.org/iris/app/home/about#ethical. 2) Mayer, M. (1967). A Boy, a Dog, and a Frog. New York: Dial Books for Young Readers. (6 drawings used). These drawings were produced by Mercer Mayer and originally appeared in Mayer, M. (1967). A Boy, a Dog, and a Frog. New York: Dial Books for Young Readers. All attempts have been made to request permission for the drawings to be held in IRIS. All sources must be cited when using or developing the drawings in research. The drawings may not be used for commercial purposes. For more information, please see https://www.iris-database.org/iris/app/home/about#ethical
